thread.title: Shots fired at house after group of 12 men turn up banging on front door
thread.title_full: Shots fired at house after group of 12 men turn up banging on front door

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Shots fired at house after group of 12 men turn up banging on front door
text:
News Shots fired at house after group of 12 men turn up banging on front door The group showed up at the house in Oldham on Wednesday and started banging on the front door - but returned hours later and fired shots at the house Share Wellbank Close, Oldham (Photo: Google)   Thank you for subscribing!   
A group of men banged on the front door of a house before returning to fire shots at a window. 
Police have launched an incident following the terrifying incident on Wellbank Close, Oldham . 
The 12 men, who were described as Asian, showed up to the house in two cars and were banging on the front door on Wednesday, February 15, at about 10.30pm. 
They left but returned the next morning at 1am and fired shots at the house. Read More Man hid body of dead girlfriend in airing cupboard for 15 months 
An upstairs window was left damaged. 
Greater Manchester Police are appealing for anyone who saw a blue VW Golf and a dark Peugeot or possibly a Fiat leaving the area shortly after 1am. 
The vehicles then turned into Meldrum Street and Honeywell Lane. 
Det Insp Kenny Blain of GMP’s Oldham Borough said: “Fortunately, no one was hurt, but the woman, who was sleeping upstairs at the time was understandably terrified when shots were fired at the house. Read More Mum tells of heartbreaking moment she gave birth to stillborn twins on hard shoulder of M6 
“We believe this was a targeted attack and I’m appealing to anyone who saw the incident or either vehicle in the area at the time to contact us. 
“I want to reassure the community that a team of officers is working on this case and we have increased patrols in the area.” 
Anyone with any information should contact police on 0161 856 9063 or 101 quoting incident numbers 76 of 16/02/17 or anonymously via the independent charity Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
